Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that a 1979 Pakistan airline advertisement showed the shadow of a jetliner on the World Trade Center.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the advertisement is related to the 9/11 attacks and suggests a connection to Osama bin Laden based on the location of Pakistan.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim acknowledges that some viewers may assume the advertisement to be a post-9/11 fabrication, indicating the existence of alternative explanations or interpretations.
